titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square College Evening News RG.39.191
titlestmt.author: Abbey Wilson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:41:53 -0400.

change.item: John Zarrillo incorporated the publications Guess and Nite News into this finding aid

did.unittitle: New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square College Evening News

physdesc.extent: in 5 boxes and 3 reels of microfilm

did.abstract: This collection contains issues from the Washington Square College Evening Division's student newspaper dating from 1926 to 1967. It documents local and national news, campus living, student clubs, and student life at NYU as it pertained to the Evening Division students. The newspaper was published under three titles: Guess (1926), Nite News (1927-1932), and Washington Square College Evening News (1933-1967). The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Newspapers are arranged in chronological order.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: New York University has had many student newspapers with many different names since its founding. The Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the Heights campus was closed. The Evening Division was the designation for students who took night classes at Washington Square College. The newspaper was published under three titles: Guess (1926), Nite News (1927-1932), and Washington Square College Evening News (1933-1967).

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Researchers must consult microfilm copies when possible due to the fragility of the original newspapers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of the Washington Square College Evening News; RG 39.191; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: John Zarrillo incorporated the publications Guess and Nite News into this finding aid in December 2019. All publications are part of a continuous run of the student newspaper for the Washington Square College Evening Division. A finding aid for the Nite News had previously been published with the call number RG 39.190.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains issues from the Washington Square College Evening Division's student newspaper dating from 1926 to 1967. It documents local and national news, campus living, student clubs, and student life at NYU as it pertained to the Evening Division students. The newspaper was published under three titles: Guess (1926), Nite News (1927-1932), and Washington Square College Evening News (1933-1967). The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

did.unittitle: Guess, Nite News, Washington Square College Evening News
